CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Figure 9 shows the incident photon - to - current conversion efficiency ( IPCE ) spectra of the ITO / PEDOT : PSS / PFDTBT-10Per + PC71BM / LiF and TiO x / Al devices.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| ITO |
| PEDOT : PSS |
| PFDTBT-10Per |
| PC71BM |
| LiF |
| TiO x |
| Al |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| ITO |
| PEDOT : PSS |
| PFDTBT-10Per |
| PC71BM |
| LiF |
| TiOx |

Note: I assumed "TiO x" is an alternative way of writing "Titanium Oxide" or "Titanium Dioxide", which are common names for TiOx.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Figure 9 shows the incident photon - to - current conversion efficiency ( IPCE ) spectra of the ITO / PEDOT : PSS / PFDTBT-10Per + PC71BM / LiF and TiO x / Al devices.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| incident photon - to - current conversion efficiency (IPCE) |
| ITO |
| PEDOT : PSS |
| PFDTBT-10Per |
| PC71BM |
| LiF |
| TiO x |
| Al |

These entities are identified as noun phrases that can be considered as properties or materials mentioned in the paragraph.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| incident photon - to - current conversion efficiency (IPCE) |
| ITO |
| PEDOT : PSS |
| PFDTBT-10Per |
| PC71BM |
| LiF |

The entities "TiO x" and "Al" are removed as they do not clearly refer to material properties, but rather to materials used in the devices mentioned in the paragraph.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Figure 9 shows the incident photon - to - current conversion efficiency ( IPCE ) spectra of the ITO / PEDOT : PSS / PFDTBT-10Per + PC71BM / LiF and TiO x / Al devices.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| IPCE (incident photon - to - current conversion efficiency) |
| ITO |
| PEDOT : PSS |
| PFDTBT-10Per |
| PC71BM |
| LiF |
| TiO x |
| Al |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| IPCE (incident photon - to - current conversion efficiency) |
| ITO |
| PEDOT : PSS |
| PFDTBT-10Per |
| PC71BM |
| LiF (material) |
| TiO x |
| Al (material) |

Explanation:

* IPCE is a material property, it is the efficiency of converting photons into electrical current.
* ITO, PEDOT : PSS, PFDTBT-10Per, PC71BM, LiF, and Al are materials mentioned in the paragraph.
* LiF and Al are presented as materials, not as properties, so they are included in the table as values of the material entities.
